llm.feedback: Overall, the draft has a strong, coherent macro frame (Regime A vs Regime D) and a credible cross‑topic lens, but it needs sharper causal linkage, tighter stock‑level translation, and tighter quantitative discipline to reach world‑class quality; the causal chain from policy/inflation paths to cash‑flow durability for cloud/AI beneficiaries and to multiple re‑rating through AI/capex cycles should be stated explicitly, and the stock implications should be anchored in first principles and the exact numbers from the cited sources. Actionable edits: 1) Rebuild the regime framework into three clearly defined scenarios (Base Regime A, Sticky Regime B, Regime D re‑pricing) with explicit mechanisms (e.g., Regime A: inflation converges, real rates decline, productivity leadership boosts cloud/AI cash flow; Regime D: AI/capex cycles re‑price margins and drive higher multiples) and an invalidation rule for each (e.g., 5–10% deviation in inflation path or a sustained wage pulse); 2) segment the write‑up by macro, policy, flows/positioning, and valuation/technicals, and explicitly map each segment’s drivers to the named equities (MSFT/Shopify, Ford, UNH/LULU), including how each driver changes intrinsic value or multiple; 3) add three stock‑level, first‑principles scenario narratives with trigger and detachment points, plus a quantified sensitivity anchor (e.g., if Fed guidance shifts 25bp, MSFT/Shopify cloud/AI pricing power sustains; if oil supply surprises, energy/transport costs compress; if tariffs resume, retailers’ inventories/tests); 4) strengthen the quantitative backbone by integrating all numeric anchors from sources: Ford Q2 EV losses ≈ $1.3B; adj EBIT ≈ 4.3%; ROIC ≈ 10.1%; revenue CAGR 2.5% (2014–2024); ACMR 2025 revenue midpoint ≈ $900m with gross margin ≈ 4%; oil oversupply with IEA 2025 supply rise ≈ 2.5 mbpd; tariff pause of 90 days preventing 30%/10% tariffs; 6) expand the watch‑list into concrete, near‑term signals with thresholds and approximate timings (Fed communications on inflation trajectory, wage growth data cadence, OPEC+/non‑OPEC supply twists, tariff policy updates, major cloud capex announcements) and attach the relevant source IDs to each signal;
